## forScreenReaderToSay() function

Returns a selenium-webdriver [Condition object](https://www.selenium.dev/selenium/docs/api/javascript/module/selenium-webdriver/index_exports_Condition.html) usable with [the wait method](https://www.selenium.dev/selenium/docs/api/javascript/module/selenium-webdriver/index_exports_WebDriver.html#wait) of selenium-webdriver.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function forScreenReaderToSay(expectedText: any, clean?: boolean): Condition<Promise<string[] | false>>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  expectedText | any | specifies the expected text, in one of the ways documented for the <code>expectedText</code> parameter of [isMatch()](./assistive-webdriver.ismatch.md)<!-- -->. |
|  clean | boolean | whether to clear from the cache all the screen reader messages until (and including) the message matched by <code>expectedText</code>. If this is false, the messages are kept in the cache, allowing them to be matched again. |

<b>Returns:</b>

Condition&lt;Promise&lt;string\[\] \| false&gt;&gt;

## Example


```ts
await driver.wait(forScreenReaderToSay("Date of departure"), 5000);

```
